text: Ooops sorry the words are incorrect let me retype that
So what I want is on mobile view the HubSpot chat widget can be on nav bar and ppl can click on the chat icon to open the widget
that's what I was trying to say :smile:
we need a hubapi sdk for react js
Is that available on HubSpot

Hi All, I’m working on an existing project with a huge amount of template files, css, js, modules, … Is there a way to detect which files are in use and which ones aren’t? So we can clean up all the old unsused things
Is HS is down ?
There's a JS SDK

Hi all, I’m possibly overthinking this. Typically when I set up a landing page, I’m using the drag and drop builder and pulling in custom modules I’ve built. For this particular client, they have a Starter plan and don’t have the drag and drop builder option. If I build an HTML landing page for them, how do I access it on the front end?
Hey Amanda, When you go to make a new page you should be able to select this as a template assuming it is available for new content (toggle in the upper right corner)

Thank you! Unfortunately, because the client is on a Starter plan, this isn’t an option. That’s why I was trying to figure out if there was a way to build in HTML and then access this file on the front end.
im not sure I follow — doesnt CMS starter include DND and themes? The CMS free version does so I would have to assume starter does as well?
So what I’m referring to with drag and drop is this.

Oh — thats a pretty old school template style and isnt really recommended any more. You’re typically much better off with the HTML hubl one and just adding a DND area into it like the template that you showed before.

You should still be able to create one of these regardless though in starter. Are you not able to do so?
Let me see. I’m not familiar with this new method of setup.

Okay, so I do need to look into that. However, I’m reminded that Starter plans are limited to Starter templates anyway. So the continuing loop is where I was trying to see if an HTML file built in HubSpot could be accessed on the front end. But it seems the answer is no.
So you can have GitHub actions deploy to HubSpot, but that doesn't handle removed and renamed files, right? How do you guys handle that?

Hey folks! Our Discord is currently a community experiment/beta we're running through the end of 2022. Right now we're rolling out limited invites to a handful of devs. We're really hopeful we can roll this out more broadly in 2023, stay tuned!
with great frustration, head banging, and broken keyboards
join in the fun on <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-deploy-action/issues/10|this github issue>!
has anyone ever tried to mass update list names?  like if you wanted to add a prefix to lists (and you have 1000 lists)
the lists api is legacy and from what i see you can only update one at a time via a post request
Thanks. Did you end up writing a script for this, John, or do you just manually delete? :scream: There’s no way to have the action run `hs remove` afterwards? Wouldn’t that fix it?
I didn’t write a script. But <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cli/issues/744|I did ask for the feature here>
we mainly use test portals before pushing to a clients portal, and the bulk of deleting / renaming happens there. Anything else that slips through the cracks we manually delete in client portals
Postman offers “Runs”. By uploading a CSV it would probably work.
Is there any way I can trigger a script once the inline thank you message is shown on the form?
Im making a popup modal and wanted the other element in the modal to disappear when the user submits the info.
Checkout these docs
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>
There's a onFormSubmit parameter

Hey all. Does anyone know if all the access tokens start with `pat-`? Our saas app supports users that go through us to do things with HubSpot, and I'm upgrading our integration with HubSpot to support tokens instead of api keys. I'm trying to avoid having fields for both api keys and tokens since api keys are going away soon.
Hi everyone, does anyone have experience working with DNN CMS who could help me providing info about the weakeness of this product??? I am competing against this product with CMS Enterprise.
